intro: Papaver croceum subsp. chinense, commonly known as the Chinese poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers consist of a cup-like corolla with five lobes and a prominent central stigma. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical significance in traditional Chinese medicine.
